title: 'We don't want URF to burn players out by having it in RGM frequently'
body: Let's play Ascension for the 15th or so time this year, and all for one on back to back weekends.

URF and Ascension are two different beasts.

Ascension is balanced as far as the top tier picks aren't so much better than average picks. Certain exceptions existed last weekend like Rengar and Kha, but I blame their recent updates rather than the gamemode. About the only champs that just aren't viable in Ascension are most marksmen, since they're given no time to CS before being rushed into a hectic teamfight and no one signed up to be a support and peel for them.

Meanwhile, the discrepancy between top tier picks and average picks in URF is so high it makes Snoop Dog jealous. You get a team of average URF champs together against a team that picks Eve, and you're fucked. The only way to fight broken URF champs is to have one yourself. That's why ARURF didn't fix much, teams were getting janky champs while their opponents were pulling out Ezreal and Wukong. The chances for success are heavily stacked right from champ select.

The biggest problem is that URF is so rarely used that Riot doesn't have to balance it. They don't give a damn that top tier picks are so gamebreaking because the mode is only around for a handful of days the entire year. If URF came more frequently, Riot would have to try to balance that shit. What are they going to do, pre-ban all the broken champs? That's a good chunk of the roster gone. Try to balance champs just for URF? The balance team is struggling with SR as it is now. Buff the weaker champs? What are you going to do, give them more CDR? Let them start three levels ahead? Change the minimap to pictures of their favorite champs in bathing suits so that players have something to look at during the constant grey screens?

After a handful of games, URF stops being fun because you have the same champs kicking your ass all the time. Ascension doesn't have that problem; most of the time, anyway. That's why modes like Ascension and Hexakill come around so often, players can actually play a lot of their favorite champs in them without getting stomped into the ground. Meanwhile, if you're not exclusively picking top tier champs in URF, you're not going to win.

I do too.  Hexa on TT is fun, but i'm not sure why we haven't seen it on SR or Black market brawlers

They did do it on SR before they moved it to TT. It was basically "Normal SR game with two tops" and flopped as people played one or two games and then didn't touch it again. It was boring and uninspired. I saw maybe one attempted double jungle, and that just led to our junglers arguing over who gets what camps.

Once it moved to TT, a map that a large section of players will never play on outside of Hexakill, players loved the constant battles that resulted from packing a lot of players in a small space. Players respond well to these types of modes, since it removes a lot of the more frustrating or slow features of League like CSing and role calling. (I personally suspect the popularity of modes like Poro King and Ascension stems in no small part from no one being forced to be support)

BMB was more of a mode to test new item ideas than anything else. The ability to buff and upgrade your own minions was neat _on paper_, but quickly became lame as it meant comebacks were difficult and snowballing was all important. If a team started to fall behind, the enemy minions quickly became too much to handle even for champions. Late game scaling champs were useless.
